TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit KeyInfoEncryptedKey extends System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoClause

Docs.summary: Wraps the class, it to be placed as a subelement of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The KeyInfoEncryptedKey class wraps the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedKey> class, which allows you to add the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedKey> class as a subelement of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfo> class. Initialize the KeyInfoEncryptedKey class to an instance of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedKey> class when you need to add an encrypted session key to your encrypted XML document.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to encrypt an XML document using an asymmetric key. This example creates a symmetric session key to encrypt the document and then uses the asymmetric key to embed an encrypted version of the session key into the XML document.
[!code-cs[Cryptography.XML.XMLEncImbedKey#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.security.crypto_91_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Cryptography.XML.XMLEncImbedKey#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.security.crypto_91_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[Cryptography.XML.XMLEncImbedKey#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.security.crypto_91_1.cpp)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor does not initialize the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoEncryptedKey> class using an instance of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedKey> class. Use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoEncryptedKey.EncryptedKey%2A> property to specify an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedKey> object when you use this constructor.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedKey encryptedKey) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that encapsulates an encrypted key.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using an object.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to encrypt an XML document using an asymmetric key. This example creates a symmetric session key to encrypt the document and then uses the asymmetric key to embed an encrypted version of the session key into the XML document.
[!code-cs[Cryptography.XML.XMLEncImbedKey#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/3db6cf8c-d921-459a-b81d-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Cryptography.XML.XMLEncImbedKey#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/3db6cf8c-d921-459a-b81d-_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[Cryptography.XML.XMLEncImbedKey#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/3db6cf8c-d921-459a-b81d-_1.cpp)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an object that encapsulates an encrypted key.
Docs.value: An object that encapsulates an encrypted key.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoEncryptedKey> class wraps the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedKey> class, which allows you to add the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedKey> class as a subelement of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfo> class. Use the EncryptedKey property to access the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedKey> class contained within the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoEncryptedKey> class.
